meanings.definition: To take in or absorb as if by swallowing
meanings.sent1: The sponge ingoted all the water from the sink.
meanings.sent2: She ingoted the information quickly during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner ingoted a sock by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The forest ingoted the sound of the chirping birds.
meanings.sent5: The black hole ingoted everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To introduce or insert into the body or substance
meanings.sent1: He ingoted the key into the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The chef ingoted the spices into the stew for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The magician ingoted a coin into his empty hand.
meanings.sent4: The artist ingoted emotions into the painting.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic ingoted the new part into the engine.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or blend into something else
meanings.sent1: She ingoted the new ideas into the project seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The chef ingoted the flavors together to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The comedian ingoted humor into his speech effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The singer ingoted passion into every note she sang.
meanings.sent5: The architect ingoted modern elements into the traditional design.
